googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* As of 2020, all Utah elections are vote-by-mail.  
* You can still request a one-time absentee ballot if you will be away from home during a specific election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to to vote online if you have a Utah driver's license or state ID card that shows your current address.  If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Utah driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Utah you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * have resided in Utah for 30 days immediately before the next election
  * be at least 18 years old on or before the next election
  * not be a convicted felon currently incarcerated for commission of a felony
  * not be convicted of treason or crime against the elective franchise, unless restored to civil rights
  * not be found to be mentally incompetent by a court of law
  * If you are 16 or 17 years of age, you may preregister to vote.
